Universal splitter

Split DIVs horizontally - absolute column with relative

Example shows how to split absolute column (ex. menu) with relative.

CSS:


                .absolute-content {
                    height: 200px;
                }

                .absolute-content div {
                    height: 200px;
                }

                .absolute-col {
                    position: absolute;
                    width: 120px;
                    height: inherit;
                }

HTML:

                

                    

                        ...
                    

                    

                        ...

JavaScript:

                 $universalSplitter.split({
                    first: '#absolute-col1',
                    second: '#absolute-col2',
                    vertical: true,
                    absolute: true,
                    splitterWidth: 10,
                    splitterHeight: 'OUTER',
                    firstMinWidth: 100,
                    secondMinWidth: 200,
                    splitterClass: 'splitter-example-3',
                    addOverflow: true,
                    initialFirstWidth: '120px',
                    initialSecondWidth: 'calc(100% - 130px)'
                });

Result:

  • Menu position 1
  • Menu position 2
  • Menu position 3

Split DIVs horizontally

Example shows how to split bootstrap col-sm-12 in row.

HTML:


                 


                    

                        ...
                    

                    

                        ...

JavaScript:


                  $universalSplitter.split({
                    first: '#top-row',
                    second: '#down-row',
                    horizontal: true, //makes horizontal splitter
                    splitterHeight: 10,
                    firstMinHeight: 50,
                    secondMinHeight: 50,
                    splitterClass: 'col-sm-12', //add custom class to splitter div
                    addOverflow: true
                });

Result:

Split DIVs vertically - parent flex

Attention! Parent .row div has display: flex; option which allow divs to have same height.

HTML:


                 

                     

                         ...
                     

                     

                         ...

CSS:


                .flex {
                    display: flex;
                }

                .splitter-example-1 {
                    float: left;
                }

JavaScript:


                $(document).ready(function(){

                    $universalSplitter.split({
                        first: '#left-col',
                        second: '#right-col',
                        vertical: true,
                        splitterWidth: 10, //in pixels
                        splitterHeight: 'OUTER', //sets splitter col height getting outerHeight from columns max height
                        firstMinWidth: 220,
                        secondMinWidth: 100,
                        splitterClass: 'splitter-example-1', //add custom splitter class
                        addOverflow: true, //adds overflow-x or overflow-y to columns
                        adjustSplitterHeight: true //sets splitter height on resize baased on max of columns height
                    });

                });

Result:

"At vero eos et accusamus et iusto odio dignissimos ducimus qui blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deleniti atque corrupti quos dolores et quas molestias excepturi sint occaecati cupiditate non provident, similique sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga. Et harum quidem rerum facilis est et expedita distinctio. Nam libero tempore, cum soluta nobis est eligendi optio cumque nihil impedit quo minus id quod maxime placeat facere possimus, omnis voluptas assumenda est, omnis dolor repellendus. Temporibus autem quibusdam et aut officiis debitis aut rerum necessitatibus saepe eveniet ut et voluptates repudiandae sint et molestiae non recusandae. Itaque earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut aut reiciendis voluptatibus maiores alias consequatur aut perferendis doloribus asperiores repellat."

Example block-level help text here.

Split DIVs vertically - table layout

Attention! Example shows using splitter on table layout display: table;display: table-cell;

HTML:


                 

                    

                        ...
                    

                    

                       ...

CSS:


                .splitter-example-2 {
                    display: table-cell;
                }

                .row-table {
                    display: table;
                }

                .col-table {
                    display: table-cell;
                    width: 50%; //initial
                    padding: 1em;
                }

JavaScript:


                $universalSplitter.split({
                    first: '#left-col',
                    second: '#right-col',
                    vertical: true,
                    splitterWidth: 10,
                    splitterHeight: 'OUTER',
                    firstMinWidth: 100,
                    secondMinWidth: 200,
                    splitterClass: 'splitter-example-2',
                    addOverflow: true,
                    adjustSplitterHeight: false
                });

Result:
